website_summaries.verdict: Good sized trap with a reliable mechanism for catching squirrels and rodents.
pros: Nice size, but not too large for storage
Action on the door works the way it should – triggers easily
This trap can catch the animals when other methods of elimination do not seem to work
cons: The quality of the materials for this trap could be better, but it works

customer_reviews.title: Item was poorly made
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it the squirrel went into the cage and it did not set the trap off. Reset the trap an the squirrel went into the trap and set it off then the squirrel pushed the door open. The latching mechanism did not lock the door. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: sircork

customer_reviews.title: Purchase this one over Havahart!
customer_reviews.text: This trap is awesome. I originally purchased a Havahart trap and it sat for 2 weeks untouched by the flying squirrels I was trying to catch. I had a camera watching the trap and it appeared as thought the way the trap door hung on the Havahart model was just a little intimidating for them. Purchased this one and I had it up for 3 days and caught flying squirrels on 3 of those days. I was able to catch 2 in one day actually on both days. This trap is very good and I highly recommend. What I don't reccomend is the instructions which were completely in Chinese.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlie

customer_reviews.title: Best Trap for a Smart Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've had a mouse who has outsmarted every trap and poison up until I got this one. It did take a few days and making sure to set the bait (peanut butter and dog food, her favorite) at the farthest point on the back of the trigger but finally got her! They also now email instructions in English since those that come with the trap itself are in Chinese but it's pretty basic anyway. Best trap I've used so far out of 7 different types and 2 brands of poison. I highly recommend it for anyone with a super smart mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.text: First 2 nights, i caught a medium sized rat and a small mouse. Both were unharmed, wire cage so no air problems and they could not get out. Easy and safe to carry with the handle and easy to release. Mine were released into a nearby wildlife preserve where they can frolic free with the little eagles, hawks, owls and gators. Great communication, and they will email instructions in English as promised. Easy to set, easy to carry, easy to release. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Causey

customer_reviews.title: Animal Chewed Through Cage Wire and escaped!
customer_reviews.text: Rodent Chewed Through Cage Wire! The trap worked 3 times. The fourth time the animal chewed trough the cage. See attached photo. The hole is only 3/4 inch... in other words I did not accidentally catch a large animal that was able to escape through a whole that size. The wire on the cage is too thin... similar to chicken wire and bends easily. The wire mesh is about 1/4 inch per square. You can see from the photo that it is very thin. I'm waiting from the company for a response and will update my review after I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: soccer doctor

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, animal will just chew through.
customer_reviews.text: Got the traps in quickly. We got 3, for 3 different spots in our home were we were having issues with squirrels. We baited all 3, and set them up which was pretty easy. The next morning I go to check the traps, to find we had indeed caught one of our squirrels! However within the 6 hours since I had set the trap and us checking, the squirrel had chewed straight through the cage and got out. The wires are so thin, that the only thing one of these would catch is a mouse. Anything that can chew through wood, could chew out of one of these in an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan W.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This trap is a little flimsy. The bar for tripping the trap is falling off and not swinging smoothly. So it probably wouldn't last more than a few weeks. The wire gauge on this trap is just too thin. Good for trapping chipmunks and mice but bad for rats which chewed right through the trap. I saw a rat in the trap one morning as I was leaving for work. When I came back later in the day I found that the guy had chewed his way out. The company emailed me for feedback. I reported my experience with it and they told me to return it so I did. Attaching pics.
customer_reviews.author: NvrFulPrice

customer_reviews.title: It's great! Can I give EXTRA stars???
customer_reviews.text: This trap is so simple its crazy. The key is to TRAIN the rat or mouse. I spent a week baiting but not setting the trap. After two days of nothing, the bait started disappearing. On the last day I set the trap and our guy was in there the next morning. It was a Big rat! And he was in there good. I took him out to nature and let him free to live a long life away from my house (or be hawk food by lunch). Either way my I'm very glad it was a humane trap and worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: LAGreg

customer_reviews.title: Not a good trap!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a terrible rat problem around my patio all summer and hoped this trap would help. I didn't want to kill them - just catch them and take them somewhere else to live. (I'm a wimp.). The problem is the latches that are supposed to grab and lock the doors after the trap is set off are not properly designed or are defective. The rats come and the doors close behind them, they enjoy the meal I leave them as bait, and then they just turn around and leave. The doors aren't latched securely and the rats just eat and leave. I bought another live trap and it works! This one is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Debra L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Well I have been hearing rat in my garage so instead of trying to kill the critters I was thinking about maybe catching him and giving it to the animal control. I have left bread, cheese, and other foods in the cage. I also set up a video camera. The basket was absolutely a fluke. He did not catch any of the rats except fed them. Now there’s more in the garage now because I think it’s a freaking hotel with all you can eat. The moral of the story is don’t buy it it doesn’t work. The best thing of you so far is the sticky Play why I’ve already caught five of them already.
customer_reviews.author: lenny G.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Item
customer_reviews.text: This trap worked great. Caught my rat in the 2nd night. Would have had him the 1st night, but I wasn't careful to make sure there was nothing in the way of the door, and a stone stopped it from closing all the way. A very simple, inexpensive solution to what could have been a real pain. The video is a little dark but I think you'll get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey B

customer_reviews.title: Mice to Squirrles - perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight but well constructed. I had two friendly but destructive squirrels in my attic and it caught them on consecutive days (large size trap). To be sure I had all of them, I kept resetting, and also caught 2 little teeny black mice, so small that they could eat peanut butter off a regular mouse trap without setting it off! This AB worked perfectly. Simple and works nicely. The "large" size is too small for something like a possum or racoon, but "large" can catch squirrels and smaller. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Works but poorly made and the squirrel chewed through the cage and broke the trigger.
customer_reviews.text: 1. The squirrel traps works but the trigger is very sensitive. A slight gust of wind and the door closes shut and I have to reset the trap again. I fixed the trigger by putting a small piece of electrical tape at the very end of the compression bar. 2. The other problem is that the cage is made of very thin wire and the squirrel started chewing through the cage. 3. The squirrel also chewed through the bar that connects to the bait plate. See the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: IkeskiVT

customer_reviews.title: Oh no, I need rat traps!
customer_reviews.text: Let’s face it, no one ever wants to even consider buying rat traps. But, rats have infested my fine city and neighborhood. Yuck! When it comes to rats (and their winged brethren, pigeons) I am no humanitarian. I chose live traps because I have dogs and I’m concerned about them catching poisoned rats or even those killed in snap traps. These are light weight but sturdy enough for the purpose. I release the vermin several miles away in open desert where they can survive or not. I suspect they will provide brief entertainment for the coyotes. On to their counterparts , the pigeons who have targeted my entryway.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Humane trap works well! Bait properly and wait...
customer_reviews.text: I caught Alvin here in about 2 hours...peanut butter is their weakness. We went for a ride and he’s living in a park near me where there are plenty of acorns, pecans and hickory nuts, but lacking in vehicle wiring harnesses and foundation vents on which to dine. I set the trap under a shrub near the foundation vent he’s destroyed and baited it with a tsp of peanut butter and one in-shell peanut on the trip lever. He was in good spirits and finished the peanut butter and peanut prior to his relocation. We arrived at the park, I opened the hatch and he scooted away to freedom!
customer_reviews.author: Jellyfish Jam

customer_reviews.title: Caught 5 little rats so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve caught 5 rats! I had some very cute rats taking my tomatoes in my garden. I spotted them a few times and definitely saw the remains of their midnight feasts. I felt bad getting rid of them, but re-homing them and giving them a tomato for the road eased my conscience. Traps are easy to use. I took the advice of another reviewer and left it locked open a couple of nights before I set it. I washed it really well between catches. I used tomatoes because that’s what they had been eating. My little veggie eaters weren’t interested in peanut butter. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works! Minus two stars because of the animals the description says will fit in here. You might be able to catch a kitten but not a cat. Even though the product is exactly the specifications listed, it is not big enough to catch all the different animals claimed, unless they're babies. I used peanut butter first. That didn't work. I then threw some dry dog food in there and caught this little guy within a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Rancheres

customer_reviews.title: Missing part in two consecutive orders
customer_reviews.text: I've now ordered, returned, and reordered this dual-door trap because of the same missing part, in BOTH ORDERS. Both times the same part: door handle, which is an integral part of one of the doors of the trap working was missing. I decided rather than continuing to expect resolution, I would go ahead and fabricate the missing part myself, but apparently this is a recurring problem with the trap being shipped from Amazon. I tried calling the manufacturer but no one answered and apparently their voicemail wasn't working correctly. I emailed the manufacturer but have had no response.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ausley

customer_reviews.title: Caught one within a couple days.  Hoping to catch more soon.
customer_reviews.text: It is much easier to use around cats. Our cat tends to try to break into traps. The locking mechanism kept him out when we caught our first mouse. It also is harder for him to trip than our old one. The bigger size means he can't just bat the cage around. Also, it is really easy to reach inside as the opening is rather large. My only qualm is that you should put something under it as it doesn't have a solid bottom and droppings fall through. Still, it is just nice to have a trap that can be set in seconds instead of minutes and doesn't trip before you put it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Handy

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two weeks, no response from seller
customer_reviews.text: There are many sterling reviews of this product, so I was not prepared for the trigger mechanism to break so quickly. There is a review that talks about poor build quality, and for me this manifested itself by a small metal piece, part of the trigger mechanism, breaking in two, where it was bent into an upside down "V" shape. It did work well: in my short time of using it I caught a young possum, several mice, and a few chipmunks, the original target. But I cannot recommend it because it broke so quickly. Should you buy one, handle it with kid gloves because sturdy it is not.
customer_reviews.author: oldgal3

customer_reviews.title: Great trap for smaller critters - but NOT for squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: The trap was very sensitive and I'm certain it would be a great product for trapping smaller critters - but not squirrels! We were able to trap squirrels very quickly - no complaints there! However, squirrels are quite destructive and each squirrel managed to cause damage to the bait plate and trip wire, which is inside the cage. I had to repair the damage after each captured squirrel. Since we purchased this trap to eliminate a problem we have with squirrels, we had to return it after a few days because it obviously wouldn't continue to hold up very long.
customer_reviews.author: Neil B.

customer_reviews.title: It works, rat caught.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, that was quick. Caught my first rat in less than 12 hours. Used a mixture of peanut butter and cheese. Will reset the traps to see if we have any more. Released the rat well away from the house in a wooded area. Only issue was it has tried to escape and had cut its paws a little. Remember to check the trap regularly please. Delighted with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: emma

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the most effective trap
customer_reviews.text: The rats in our house had gotten wise to all manner of snap and glue traps. If they see someone else get snagged by a trap they will avoid it like the plague. They were even avoiding bait we'd used before in snap traps. They KNEW. This trap was a godsend. I think one of the reasons it worked so well was that it caught live, so the other rats saw their buddy chomping merrily away at the bait even if they were stuck. We caught two the first night (I checked and reset). Another the following night. Then another a few days later. Compared to our snap and glue traps, which all went ignored.
customer_reviews.author: Karen T.

customer_reviews.title: Metal Shards Stuck in My God Forsaken Hands
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. Don't touch it with your bare hands or else you get metal shards stuck in your hand. Happened to me and I spent an hour picking them out. Handle it with gloves. The instructions are not in English, so you wouldn't know.
customer_reviews.author: Kobld

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - caught/relocated multiple rock squirrels
customer_reviews.text: This does the job for catching mice and other rodents. Caught a little grey mouse last night and drove him (in the cage) elsewhere to free him. I actually bought this for pack rats, but haven't caught one yet. Should be able to do the job. Of note: The trap door is a bit finicky and requires touch and patience to set it. Once it's set, it tends to stay set until a visitor comes a-callin'. UPDATE: this trap lasted me a few years, during which time I was able to catch and relocate 4 rock squirrels before #4 finally tore the bait tray apart. I’ve been so happy with this trap that I am now buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Dickman

customer_reviews.title: Caught Squirrel Within Minutes
customer_reviews.text: On Thursday May 28, 2020, my indoor/outdoor cat brought a Mojave Desert Squirrel into my home. The squirrel was able to escape my cat, but was still in my home. Fortunately (with the help of my cat) I was able to isolate it in my guest bathroom. After a lot of research, I purchased this <AB> trap. The trap arrived Saturday morning and I set it up within minutes, using nuts as bait. I planned on waiting a couple of hours before checking the trap, but I couldn't resist. I opened the door within 30 minutes and the squirrel was successfully caught! I released the squirrel into the wild as planned. I strongly recommend this trap. Thank you, <AB>!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donz0

customer_reviews.title: This works all right!
customer_reviews.text: Using outside in VA. In 24 hours I caught a mouse and then a squirrel. The only problem is I don't want squirrels I want the chipmunks living under my walkway. The opening is large enough fro a squirrel. When you get them you have to use coat-hanger to lift th bar to let them out. I wish there was a smaller version. So, I put a plastic large plastic box over th chipmunk hole to keep out squirrels. I baited this with peanut butter and voila, I had the rascal that was destroying my front walk. Very effective for chipmunks with box over th top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: By the way please don't kill squirrels - they are nice animals that express emotion and have families
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT catch rats. Every night they lick the peanut butter and the trap stays open. The first night I used it I caught a mouse and let it go. Second night I caught a possum and let it go. After that, nothing, night after night. I tried dog biscuits in the 2 traps I bought, but the biscuits were gone and the traps were still open. Maybe the traps wear out. I'll have to use a kill trap. By the way please don't kill squirrels - they are nice animals that express emotion and have families.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Woman

customer_reviews.title: It works the first time!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked the first time! Put some peanut butter and the mouse was caught during the night. I put the peanut butter on a piece of paper towel as I didnt want it to just leave it sticking inside. I would strongly recommend putting a garbage bag or some plastic underneath the cage so that you dont end up with a mice droppings and urine on the floor. Much easier to clean up afterwards. You can pick up the cage by the handle and release the mouse without getting bitten or touching the mouse. Wear gloves obviously as mice can carry viruses and what not. I just sprayed disinfectant on it afterwards and wiped clean with paper towels.
customer_reviews.author: QwertyDvork

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: This a rather simple design rat trap intended to be non lethal to rats. It came with all the different instructions and ideas on how to use the product but I didn't seem to work for me. I don't know if the rats are so smart that they can understand that this is a trap and they dont go in. But more than that the process of resetting the bait is very difficult, you have to put your hand all the way in the trap where possibly the rat might have been last night - take the old bait out and replace with new one. I wish there was a top side access door to the bait area.
customer_reviews.author: Anish

customer_reviews.title: It catches mice and rats!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a mouse and a rat coming into my yard every night to raid my bird feeders. I purchased a set of those colored plastic traps which did not work. I repeatedly found them with the door closed, but empty. My guess is as the mouse or rat nudged it while investigating the trap would spring. This trap caught the mouse the first night, and the rat the second. Both were released in fields miles away from any houses. UPDATE: I have now caught five rats with this, very good.
customer_reviews.author: Isis the Black

customer_reviews.title: Great way to  relocate squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price and simplicity. Well built but the trigger mechanism is a little flimsy. When the squirrel is caught it moves around violently and dislocates the pin that shuts the trap. One time I could not find it and thought I had to buy a new trap. So my suggestion to the makers of this cage is to include an extra trigger pin and a sketch showing how to restore the trigger mechanism. So far I have already relocated 6 squirrels to a nicer place and away from my vegetable beds that they kept digging up
customer_reviews.author: Muffinmaster

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to catch and release our way out of a serious rodent problem in the Colorado mountains at our cabin. I caught something every day, drove the little furry fellas down the road for a little vacation time and set them free. I feel better, they feel better. Catches everything from tiny field mice to full grown chipmunks. Don't let anyone tell you about ways (soap or sonics) to rid yourself of outdoor pests that are eating your car's insulation. Trap em and send em away. We no longer see anyone around. I still bait it up but we catch very little any more. So worth the money and effort. Easy to use and works every time.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great trap
customer_reviews.text: Have used a fair variety of this style humane trap - this is the best to date. Purchased the AB Traps Pro-Quality Live Animal Humane Trap Catch and Release Rats Mouse Mice Rodents and Similar Sized Pests - Safe and Effective - 10.5" x 5.5" x 4 ASIN: B013FLER72 from ABRetail. Arrived well packaged in perfect condition. Looks and feels sturdy and solid so even though I would gladly do business with this seller again, probably won't have to replace this trap any time soon!
customer_reviews.author: Em M

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Best quality traps out there of this type. Easy to use over and over. They won’t stand up to a big squirrel or a rabbit, but for rats and mice and small squirrels you can’t beat them. I’ve tried snap traps, and even electric, these beat those hands down. They work when the snaps or electric won’t. We live in the country, have horses, and had a huge rat issue. Not any more. We use horse grain (integrity brand) for bait, the rats and mice (and occasional squirrel or rabbit) can’t resist it. I just set the trap and sprinkle a little grain on the trip mechanism from the outside of the trap.
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for Us.  Rat's Too Smart
customer_reviews.text: Looked like it could possible work. Some of the reviews gave it a positive vote. I gave it a good try, followed the directions and also got advice from a pest exterminator. Move the trap around for the rats to get use to it then bated it. Finally found a bate they would like. Every time the food was missing the next day with the trap untripped. The last time it was tripped, food gone and no rat inside. Rat was either strong enough to push the door open or crawled through a hole and the steel material is strong. I resorted to another method.
customer_reviews.author: Shivani McK

customer_reviews.title: This little one DID NOT get away!
customer_reviews.text: Chipmunks: they're super cute -- from afar . . . way afar, but a little too bold hanging out around my deck and front door. Simple to set and despite my worst fear (of the little beast head-butting his or her way out the door during transport and running loose in the car) he/she used the time on the way to the freedom launch to nibble a couple more cheesy goldfish crackers. I caught four of these little buggers in 1/2 a day -- every one of 'em seemed thrilled with the goldfish crackers lol.
customer_reviews.author: PettyMsDemeanor

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and set up. Cought a mouse on the first try. I baited the trap with celery and peanut butter. The bait hook seems to be too small to use, but it didn't really matter. The little guy was unable to escape, and didnt hurt itself either (I had a chipmunk kill itself trying to escape the last humane trap I had). This seems to work really well, and keep unwanted guests out of not just my house, but my chicken coop too.
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice

customer_reviews.title: excellent for very small mice
customer_reviews.text: This trap was a bit smaller than I thought it would be, which was a good thing for me. I knew the mouse I wanted to trap was very small. I caught her the second night when I placed the trap next to my garage door where she sneaks in to steal my dog's food. He just watches her steal it btw. She was so cute I let her go in my yard so she can keep living here... fiance asked why I bothered buying a trap. If you need to catch a very small mouse this trap is for you. I used a little bit of peanut butter on the bait plate and stuck dog food on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great trap!
customer_reviews.text: At first I didn’t catch anything. But I quickly realized it was my fault and the trap itself it amazing. So I was just placing the trap randomly instead of access points/ point of most travel hugging a corner and I found peanut butter and chicken feed works hella good. I’ve set the trap 7 times this week and have had 6 catches! Not bad for the price, pretty easy to clean just use a hose on Highpower. Just keep messing with what kind of bait to use and leave it locked for a couple nights so the rats can get use to it. Always use fresh bait, I find it works best.
customer_reviews.author: David Lunar

customer_reviews.title: Bye-bye chipmunks
customer_reviews.text: We have been over run with chipmunks this year, due to their love of wild bird food. The have damaged insulation and undermined our boardwalk. If they took the bird food and lived in the woods, I would not mind, but we can't let them do damage to our home. These traps (I now have 2 of them), are easy to set with a little peanut butter and sunflower seeds, and we have caught and released close to 20 of them in the two weeks we have been using them. They don't harm the little critters and it's easy to relocate them to another area far from our yard.
customer_reviews.author: happy in wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable squirrel trap
customer_reviews.text: This is sold as a trap that can handle squirrels. I watched the front end of a squirrel go in, his/her tail wouldn’t fit. Also the spring closure was so weak that the squirrel backed up out of the trap while the door closure slowly came down on said squirrel’s tail. In Asian market they’re sold as rat traps - thin gage aluminum construction would be no match for a rat with teeth. Overpriced 3x. Worth a laugh!
customer_reviews.author: A cannon

customer_reviews.title: Traps rats quite well!
customer_reviews.text: Our house has vacant lots on all sides and we were starting to have a rat problem. They came around because of the bird seed on the ground from the bird feeder. The birds are beautiful and I wasn’t about to get rid of the feeder. The first day I baited the trap with cut up fruit and put it out at dusk and within two hours it trapped three rats. Separately, not all at once. What you do with rat after it’s trapped is up to you. Next we’re baiting it to trap those damned exotic iguanas that are invading South Florida.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to use and setup right out of the box. I was able to humanely catch the pesky rat in less than an hour from receiving this in the mail. One thing I would say could use improvement is the trigger mechanism, the rat spent several minutes in the trap eating food without setting it off. I had to reposition and adjust it to get it to go off and shut the door. Overall a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SectorNine

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase from Yorgogo
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to use my trap as it arrived severely crushed. I suggest not buying from Yorgogo (I have left a seller review for them as well). After inspecting the trap, I have decided to replace it with a different one. The trap is flimsy and easily crushed and the wires are thin and would be easy to chew through. My local hardware store had a much heavier duty one available that was only a few dollars more. Save your money and buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm the very first night we had this out. Put some peanut butter candy we had and lo, we had a trapped visitor next morning. What I didn’t know at the time is mouse could get spooked and out of desperation try to gnaw their way out of the cage. Poor little guy would have bled out if he had been left in there for longer. Made a mental note for next time to catch and release them early. Good value buy. Easy to install, clean and reset.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram

customer_reviews.title: VERY EFFECTIVE & HUMANE!
customer_reviews.text: We had numerous chipmunks running around our property. As you know, they can be very destructive, especially when colder weather comes and they find their way into the attic of your home or between the walls. We put a little peanut butter with sunflower seeds pressed into it on the plate. We quickly caught two of the little critters and relocated them to our nearby state park. We keep it set all the time now in hopes of catching more. Only thing is, the racoons come in at night and flip it around trying to get the peanut butter! I've caught them on our trail cam!
customer_reviews.author: Online Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Mice will die in a few hours due to stress
customer_reviews.text: If you use these to catch mice, make sure you are around to hear the trap closing and/or check on it frequently. If a mouse is in this thing half the day it will die. They get really freaking stressed out and just straight-up die. It's a bad way to go. A standard mouse trap is a lot more humane for killing. However, if you due intend to be around, or if you rig it up to some kind of alerting system, then go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works great
customer_reviews.text: so these traps really work well for us. we have been trapping chipmunks for about a week. I would say more traps would be helpful say three or four. The trips to drop animals off seem to better if you have more traps it almost seems wasteful when i think about the number of trips we made with one trap. We have two now and am wishing i had more like four. so we trap about four a day and then hang it up for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bell

customer_reviews.title: It is likely useful for very small animals such as rats and mice ...
customer_reviews.text: It is likely useful for very small animals such as rats and mice or even chipmunks, but not at all useful for squirrels such as gray or fox squirrels. The box is too small and the trip mechanism is too sensitive and releases the door while the animal enters or noses around the trap, thus not fully capturing the critter. Or, if the mechanism is adjusted even slightly to accommodate, then it does not trip and capture the animal. Very lightly made as well (in China).
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It did the job
customer_reviews.text: I had something eating my young vegetables just as they started to sprout. It didn't eat them (which would have been OK, they need to eat) but it just chewed the stems and left them. It obviously was maintaining a path. I eventually got a squirrel the chewed threw the metal trap mechanism (I wish my teeth were that strong) and other metal frameworks. All is well. We released him in a local undeveloped area with a park near by and other squirrels. However, 5 months later, something is doing the same. So, I'll buy another one, because the first one just wasn't the same after the first squirrel.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse13

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and humane
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for some squirrels that got in the unfinished basement. i caught the dumb ones first, feed the smart ones a bit to make them comfortable again, and I got the rest usca couple of mice. Really a great product that I can use instead of poison or bullets. They all got a ride to the hunting club land to start new lives. No trace of any infestation or further damage, which is what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Watts36022

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed :-(
customer_reviews.text: Well, I thought I was going to humanely snag an outdoor rat I've seen in the backyard, but a squirrel got in the trap. Early this morning, I let the very angry critter out. The Atomic Barbie Rat Trap is totally trashed. There is a 1.75" x 2.0" hole chewed in the rear of the trap. The metal bait platform and trap mechanics are in pieces. I do not know how to add photos here otherwise, I'd include them. Sadly, there is no way I can see repairing the trap. If Amazon or the trap company can be of assistance, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: kim d

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Put the trap out one morning and had a chipmunk in a few hours. The chipmunks have been trashing our flower gardens and up-ending plants and we had tried all kinds of the things you drop in the holes and tunnels the chipmunks made but nothing worked. With both ends of the trap open, they won't know they are trapped until it is all over. This is a perfect and humane way to trap them and take them to another home somewhere down the road. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon P.

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This rat trap works well. Put it out 2 nights in a row and caught 2 rats. Would give it 5 stars if there was a good handle on top to carry the loaded trap.
customer_reviews.author: Texan

customer_reviews.title: When the mouse traps don't work use this
customer_reviews.text: Tried catching a tiny mouse on standard traps for days. The mouse is smart and avoided all the [12] traps right in front of the mouse hole. I was turned onto this product. After getting it I slapped on a bit of peanut butter and set the trap. 5 minutes later the tiny mouse was in the cage. For smaller mouse, it's important to set the gate pin so the slightest pressure on the plate closes the trap door. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Eden C

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This trap worked VERY well for me. It is easy to set, easy to clean, and a perfect size for rats and mice. I would have given it 5 stars if it had a top handle. I regularly get it set, but in the process of setting it on the ground, trigger it and have to re-set. But that is minor.... and if it ever becomes a major issue, I could make some sort of top handle myself probably. I really like the way this trap works, and have recommended it to friends. It is one of my two best "catchers"...
customer_reviews.author: Shirley in OR

customer_reviews.title: My wife is very happy
customer_reviews.text: We had a flying squirrel move into our attic and he was making a racket in the middle of the night. The havahart trap was too big and easy to set off. I ordered the 10.5" x 5.5" x 4.5" cage. It arrived last night and I set it up before I went to bed. I went into the attic to check the cage after getting home from work, and I was pleasant surprised that I caught Rocky. Rocky went into the WitSec program and was relocated 5 miles from our home. My wife is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tin Man

customer_reviews.title: Caught it!
customer_reviews.text: It works! The Rat Trap arrived as promised on one day shipping and we caught the rat first time out. Super simple, easy setup, all aluminum housing and foolproof mechanism with nothing to wear out or go wrong. Put a brick or stone on top on each side of the trip wire and some around the rear to hold the cage in place so inquisitive rats don't push it around and trip it. English instructions were emailed when ordered. Peanut butter with a little banana on top is a great bait.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Laurenzi

customer_reviews.title: Humane, Easy & Effective Rodent Trap
customer_reviews.text: We wanted something humane that would not hurt the rodent, whatever it might be. We had no idea that there were three! We set this trap using Dubliner cheese and Trader Joe’s sunflower seeds, but caught nothing the first night. On the second night we did, a fat little rat! We set the trap again the next night and caught another smaller one. We repeated it again the next night, this photo is the third one we caught. He’s even posing for the camera, showing off his round little belly before going to meet the rest of his family at the drop off spot. I like how it safely catches them, but doesn’t hurt them or grab their little tails.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: May not only catch smaller animals!
customer_reviews.text: On day 1 I caught a chipmunk, but it was dead when I got home from work. On day 2, I caught a squirrel. I was surprised it fit in the cage. It was going crazy! On day 3, I caught 2 live chipmunks and drove them several miles away, and then caught a 3rd that was dead when I got to it. On the morning of day 4, the trap was gone when I got up at daylight. I am guessing a larger animal got its head stuck and ran with it. We are not in an area where it would have been stolen or anything. I am ordering again and hoping for better results!
customer_reviews.author: D.Watson

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I caught several rats with this after they infested my garage (seemingly, overnight). It works well; however, one of the more aggressive rats (each rat legit had a different personality) chewed a tiny hole in it in a matter of seconds. I watched him do it. He made eye contact with me as he ripped away with gnashing teeth. The trap is still usable, but if another Master Splinter comes along, it could, perhaps, chew its way to freedom. Side note: be careful when handling the cage with a rodent in it because they will try to bite your fingers through the bars. Seems like common sense but that didn’t stop me from almost getting a nibble.
customer_reviews.author: CurlyQ33

customer_reviews.title: Set, catch, let them go far away.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic trap, easy to set up, easy to catch and easy to let go! Squirrels are chewing through my garbage can, now they have free access with holes in 3 garbage cans. Was fed up, bought this, set it and caught two the first day, three the second and I have it outside now which I am sure there will be another in. Once caught I pick it up by the handle drive miles away, let them go, so simple. Great if you want to get things done fast and inexpensively.
customer_reviews.author: Tim McCallan

customer_reviews.title: Got a squirrel
customer_reviews.text: This is just big enough to contain a squirrel. After about a week, the squirrel could not resist the dried apricot. He was scared but we put it in a newspaper lined large bin in our car until we reached the wooded area. He shot right out as soon as the door had a crack open. Wear jeans & gloves! Also, wear gloves when setting this up so human smell is not on it. Line the inside bottom with a piece of cardboard because animals do not like the feel of wires.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used the trap last night and found a rat in it this morning. I did secure the bait with a wrapping of wire to ensure the rat would have to tug at the bait which would trip the spring (closing the door). The night before, the rat just dragged the bait out of the trap and ate it. Smart rat! Just remember to secure the bait with wire, rubber band, etc. and it will do the job. I recommend this trap.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Directions come in English now, highly effective rat catcher
customer_reviews.text: Rats ate my grapes, green beans and were starting on my tomatoes when I finally declared war on rats. Never had a problem until this year. This cage has caught a rat 2/3 nights when on the ground next to a cherished OroGold cherry tomato. Used cheese for the lure, scattered sunflower seeds up to and underneath the cage. Great device. Handle of the door is strong enough to use as a handle for the entire cage plus rat to take it to another area, don't need to worry about getting bit or scratched. Amazon has listened and emails a set of directions in English, for those of us who don't read Chinese. Highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Pediatrician Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easily set off.
customer_reviews.text: The rats are smarter than smart. Haven’t had much luck in catching more than 3 rats in a month and a half now. Perhaps the fall when it’s colder they will fall prey more. These work well, hard to set and place in an area once they’re set cause the smallest bump in moving will set the trap off and you have to reset again. Have to also make sure to place these traps somewhere where the flaps are not obstructed by any objects either or the prey will get away. Overall better than the snap traps so far but need something more to lure the rats in.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z.

customer_reviews.title: Catches mice like nobody's business
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for to catch rats, but never succeeded. I think this was because they were already afraid of a similar live trap that had been previously deployed. On the other hand, this thing caught tons of mice. They don't seem to catch on to it, and it catches and holds them effectively and humanely. If you have the time and a place to release mice, this guy does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I suspected rats in the attic. I bought 2 of these traps, and set them immediately. The mechanism is simple, and the traps are not huge (for my circumstances). With wire hanger pieces, I added another bait tray using (peanut butter on) a plastic bottle cap. I installed it "over head" so rats would have to reach - therefore, stepping on trigger pad. The traps worked excellent for me. I trapped 3 rats in just 4 days/nights. I recommend this product because it's simple, effective, at a very reasonable cost. Update: Caught 7 rats, already .. I love these traps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: While watching TV I started hearing local squirrels in our attic. The next day I heard them again and then was blessed by a visit from a squirrels nose when it poked through the hole they made in the ceiling above our TV. Needless to say that did not go over well.... Ordered these, used salted peanuts as bait and three days later the squirrels have be relocated to a new wooded area. Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Rats No More
customer_reviews.text: Boy this works ... I've had some big rats in my garage .... even my killer cat wouldn't mess with them. Set the Barbie trap on my workbench, baited it with some dog food, and caught my first LARGE rat in about 10 minutes. Caught the other three within 24 hours. Since I am a softhearted old cuss, I took them out to my hayfield and sprung them loose . (My wife is not happy about my merciful streak.) But ... I figure .... if they return to the garage, I'll just catch them again. Terrific product ... perfectly obvious how to use it ... and there is no way a trapped critter is gonna get out once it closes.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Connection

customer_reviews.title: Needs A Bait Holder
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great but I had to drill holes in the bait /trip pan , and screw two small screws in from the bottom , so I have something to hold the bait. The mice were stealing it without tripping. It definitely works better than the plastic "tube" ones. I will probably get one or to more of these but will be modifying the lack of a bait holder. The company could make those changes very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chari

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but squirrels are strong and will bend the trigger
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the trap. I used it to catch 14 squirrels, 6 chipmunks and, quite surprisingly, a carolina wren!! The only negative is the wires used are not quite strong enough to stand up to a frantic squirrel. They routinely bend the pan/trigger mechanism and have broken some of the outside wires. Still..it is well worth the price. Put a little chunky peanut butter on the pan and you're good to go. I suspect it would catch mice as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I used this trap to catch the "smart" mice that avoided all my other traps. It took several days before the first catch, then every two to three days I would catch a mouse. The best bait I ended up with was Blue Buffalo ( Freedom, grain free, small bread, chicken recipe for dogs) . I put one small bit in the middle of the tray and one small bit at the back of the tray. Patience was the key. I set the tray loop right to the end of the release bar for a hair trigger. This trap is EXCELLENT. You have to outsmart the critters with your bait choice.
customer_reviews.author: pepper

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: We had a larger one for catching backyard bunnies. It wouldn't set off for the squirrels that were eating my vegetable garden. Once setting this one up just 4 days ago, we have caught 3 squirrels and I lost count, but I think 4 mice. I'm sure they are enjoying their new homes much better than they would have enjoyed remaining in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Have to read the instructions carefully
customer_reviews.text: Sadly if you put the handle in before vs after the trigger, it makes it such that when you pick it up the door isn't secured and the gopher got out. The next time the door got stuck on grass and closed only partly so lost the gopher twice. The spring isnt strong enough to close the door if some blades of grass are in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amz J

customer_reviews.title: This trap worked for birds & mice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trap to try to catch a domestic pigeon that has been living at my house for weeks so I could bring it to a lady who rescues them. Unfortunately, this cage was a bit too small to catch the pigeon but it did catch a sparrow within 5 minutes of putting it out with some seeds (it was released without harm). The mechanism that closes the door is very sensitive. If I ever needed to catch smaller animals like mice I would definitely use this. Update: this trap was also able to catch 2 mice that were living near my garbage bin outside. I used bird seed to attract them.
customer_reviews.author: Ame1971

customer_reviews.title: Caught the mouse and went back to sleep to deal with it in the morning
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of options out there for mouse traps, even no-kill traps like this one. However this one stands out for being both effective as well as providing the luxury of going back to sleep and dealing with it in the morning. Most of the live-catch traps are very small tube-shapes with little space and almost no ventilation. Having learned from prior experience that those traps are not no-kill if you don't deal with it soon enough. The mice get caught inside those tiny traps and essentially panic and overheat and die a horrible death. The small tube traps are also usually opaque plastic so you cannot see what is caught inside.
customer_reviews.author: msr-norwalk

customer_reviews.title: It worked fast
customer_reviews.text: We had a chipmunk that took up residence under our front porch. He kept digging out the dirt and tunneling under it. I was worried that he would cause damage to the porch structure, so I bought this trap. We caught him in less than 24 hours and released him in a park (several miles away!) It worked easily and was much less expensive than having to pump concrete under my porch after he damaged it. Now I have the trap if another one appears or if a family member needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Supermom

customer_reviews.title: Great trap.
customer_reviews.text: we have an ongoing mouse problem in our attic. We had a professional come in and supposedly covered any holes they were coming but they keep coming in from somewhere. We put out kill traps, and sticky pads (which actually disappeared, scary huh?) but as soon as we started using these Live Animal humane trap, we catch a mouse every day, transport it a couple miles away on our way to town and release it. This product is great. I hate killing any animal and was glad our kill traps didn't do their job. I recommend this trap to anyone with a rodent problem. It is easy to set and easy to release. Thanks for your great product.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: I finally caught a little roof rat that has been avoiding snap traps after it missed him and he learned from the experience. It took a few days for him to get used to seeing the trap, and then he took just the teaser peanut butter smeared on the front entrance. Confidence and my special mix of peanut butter, honey and birdseed is what it took for ratty to go to the trigger plate. I think this trap will be less apt to miss than a snap trap. Once a snap trap misses, they never come back.
customer_reviews.author: ItsHotinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Does what is should do
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two traps to capture pests that are ruining my yard. After a few uses the trigger mechanism in one was essentially destroyed by the critters as it is made of thin metal. While it is difficult to gain access to the trigger mechanism inside of the trap, I was able to reshape it enough to get the trap to set and hope it works. Three stars because of the flimsy meta used for the trigger. Otherwise, the trap works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Frog Prince

customer_reviews.title: Flemsy if you catching anything larget than a mouse, bird, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I caught a squirrel, recorded the entire session on video only to come back and watch the video show the animal escaped. The latch to keep the door closed once the trap has been sprung is very weak so the squirrel squeezed under the door to escape. I called my self adjusting the latch and caught another larger squirrel only to find this one was able to squeeze between the out of the trap by pushing against the side of the trap door and wiggle his way out. This thing is only good for giving squirrels some exercise and free nuts. Don't Buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. TJ. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Humane Solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a human solution if you care about life like me. Even the uninvited life in your grill. Worked perfect, very well made and the mechanism works and it is very sensitive, even has a locking bolt to keep the critter inside. Keep in mind that this is not intended for a lion or a wild cat or a Rat from an Edgar Allan Poe's story. For a regular rat, mouse, squirrel, lizard or other small to medium visitor is great.
customer_reviews.author: SergioArb

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and effective
customer_reviews.text: This trap is well designed and seems more durable than the other similar trap I purchased. The openings at both sides are nice for putting this in the path traveled by rodents, increasing the chances that they will pass through it. I located it between a wall and large object that rodents were passing between outside a horse shed, and baited it with pieces of a soft horse treat and grain. I caught 2 mice in 2 successive days of using it.
customer_reviews.author: lilian

customer_reviews.title: Really a successful live trap!
customer_reviews.text: I caught two red squirrels, two chipmunks, and a mole in the first week I had this trap. That is so much better than the other trap I tried. I immediately ordered another one of these for mice in my garage this winter. Only 4 stars?: letting the animals out of the trap is a little disconcerting. I use gloves to let them out because you have to move the bar to the top before the door will open. The last squirrel pushed his way out of the trap before the bar was half-way up! But he was focused on getting the hell outta there, and took off in a flash without looking back at me.
customer_reviews.author: lovit or leavit

customer_reviews.title: AB Humane Animal Catcher
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trap to get those pesky critters. It is well made and is so easy to set up! I have something that comes in my unfinished attic space. The trap is set with peanut butter but am adding sunflower seeds soon, I also have the door open so they feel easy about entering. There are no large openings in this house so whatever it is chews a lot & hoping it is a chipmunk and not brother rat. Thank you for my next step toward a quiet house.
customer_reviews.author: arlene suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Quality Trap!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Chinese version a while back of the same design. It was made of inferior materials and a small rat actually chewed through the mesh material to escape. The <AB> trap is made of superior material, thicker in all respects. The latch and spring mechanism is smooth and works well. Very happy with this product, recommeded buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Vigallon

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Do Not waste your money on this trap You can probably build a better one Spend the extra few bucks and get a better one I wanted to return it but it was going to cost more in shipping then it is worth
customer_reviews.author: pogo86

customer_reviews.title: Best live traps around
customer_reviews.text: These live traps are so easy to set-up with bait and to release the little critters that make their way into them, that I now own four of them. (I have a lot of land and outbuildings.) The first one I bought 4 years ago still looks and works as well as the first day I obtained it. From mice to large pack rats, these traps can handle their removal from places they should not be, to a new home where they won't bother anyone. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cobaltblue

customer_reviews.title: Works without injuries
customer_reviews.text: The trap is humane as long as you're mindful of where you release the animals. We waited to release the mice together on a nice day in a place where they could find some cover. We put them in a large bin with holes drilled in the lid to hold them in until release day. We caught two older mice first and smaller ones within a couple of days. We caught one other about a month later who unfortunately wasn't released with the others. We sealed up the house and it's been several months...so far no mice or signs of any.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I use this trap along with a Havahart 1083 trap next to each other -- so that the rabbits have their pick. This trap catches most of the them. Once caught, the rabbits are in good shape and I relocate them a few miles away near hiking trails -- hopefully they find their friends that I previously relocated. These traps do work -- takes lots of patience -- need to lure them in (I use Apples or Plums) -- some rabbits, initially, are successful at getting the food, but eventually they get cocky, and the door closes. I use a Nest Cam, to monitor their ongoings. Made a big difference in my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Goldrush

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel chewed through the door
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the 12.5" x 6.5" x 5" Single Door 2-Pack The first time we used this trap, a squirrel chewed its way through the door. While the trap itself is plenty large enough for a squirrel, the wire mesh is too thin. I'm trying to return these, but haven't received a response from the seller yet. -- Update seller came through and made it right. Changing from 1 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: harvester

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Trapped a skunk 2nd night, have trapped 2 of them now in 2 weeks. I have been trying to catch a squirrel but it seems that the skunks have been doing all the digging and damage, not so much the squirrel. If you do trap a skunk, read on the Internet what to do. I have trapped one twice in this little cage, not one of them sprayed at all and I drove them 3 miles away. Still trying to catch the trick squirrel! These traps work great. Definitely lock them open and get the critters used to going in and getting the goodies. Once you see your bait is going bye bye, set the trap!
customer_reviews.author: Technology Geek

customer_reviews.title: Better for rats than squirrels, but still works for both
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple design, and in this case simple works well. For rats, the trap works as advertised. Those dumb, lumbering diseases on legs are caught every time. For squirrels, even though I got the medium trap (which can easily accommodate a squirrel), sometimes the squirrels are a little too quick or possibly too educated to get trapped as I live near a college. But like with everything else in life, persistence pays off and soon these problem critters can be caught and safely relocated elsewhere, such as the really rude neighbor's yard down the street.
customer_reviews.author: FM Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the review I wrote for the Havahart Animal trap and it's true for this brand, too. It works, pure and simple. Got it three days ago and each of the two nights we put it out (with grapes, nuts, etc.) we caught a rat. It's become one of my husband's favorite activities - hopping out of bed to see what he will find. We weren't really aware we had rats roaming the yard and were hoping for a ground squirrel but, what the heck, we'll settle for what we can get. We also ordered another brand, Havahart animal trap, at the same time and it's been equally effective.
customer_reviews.author: 4annie

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: When a couple chipmunks decided to take us residence around our old house, we felt they needed a different home and wanted to help them relocate. It took a few days to figure out a good location but after setting the trap and baiting it with some peanut butter we were able to round up our visitors. The mechanism is very sensitive to trip the trap door and very easy to set. So we were able to humanely capture and move them to what should be a suitable new location closer to Mother Nature and less of a cute but undesirable presence around our home.
customer_reviews.author: R.C. Arndt

customer_reviews.title: The chipmunk and squirrel hotel!
customer_reviews.text: So I got the medium size because I wanted to trap squirrels as well as chipmunks. It’s great I used peanut butter and sunflower seeds. I got at least one animal trapped every hour. You don’t believe squirrels fit in there but they do. I check the trap every hour and don’t like to leave it out overnight; the squirrels go nuts :). Great trap, I have a woodchuck to get next and will buy another much butter trap for him. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: A. Sudol

customer_reviews.title: I have many different traps from havahart to rat zapper - this one didn't catch even single rat
customer_reviews.text: I have many different traps from havahart to rat zapper, disposed many many rats but this one didn't catch even single rat. Tried to set it sensetive as hair, nothing. Plus very bad design, even if will catch something - the top is not solid and animal can bite you easily. Same for door release. Not recommended...
customer_reviews.author: Amaz0ner

customer_reviews.title: Rat trap for catch and release
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to get a rat trap so I could catch the rats and then release them a few miles away. This trap worked very well. I caught two rats and were able to let them go. I also caught a few birds but were able to release them. Seems to work pretty well. It took a few days before a rat ventured in but the trap worked great. Took a few minutes to figure out the mechanism but it's pretty easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simonds
